Fixing dimensions¶

RAMS output, by default, uses dimensions named phony_dim_0, phony_dim_1, etc. The problem lies when two dimensions have the same size. For example below, the data has the dimensions ``[‘z’, ‘y’, ‘x’] = [300, 32, 32] ``. .. code-block:

netcdf c-A-2008-08-31-000000-g1 {
dimensions:
        phony_dim_0 = 32 ;
        phony_dim_1 = 200 ;
variables:
        float AGGREGATET(phony_dim_1, phony_dim_0, phony_dim_0) ;
}

However, since x=y=32, RAMS assigns the dimension phony_dim_0 to both x and y, causing errors notably in xr.open_mfdataset()

RAMSlibs has two ways of overcoming this problem. The first is to rebuild the xr.Dataset with the correct dimenions using fix_duplicate_dims
